title: DECODE Model-Based STEM Teacher Professional Development Program: TPACK Competency Enhancement for Mathematics Teachers and Integrated Computational-Formula-Graph Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level understanding of mathematical theories (equations, functions, statistics) and hands-on experience with digital tools
context.additional_context: Blended training program conducted in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments, including urban/suburban/rural learners. Focuses on strengthening computational, measurement, and analytical skills to address math education disparities across diverse settings.

learning_goals: Enhance instructional design capabilities by applying the three stages of the DECODE model (Demonstration-Co-development-Evaluation) to strengthen mathematical problem-solving skills
Develop at least three types of instructional materials visualizing equations, graphs, and statistics using digital tools (e.g., GeoGebra, Desmos)

Learners identify ≥2 elements each from the TPACK framework’s Technology (T), Content (K), and Pedagogy (P) domains, create one integrated lesson plan combining mathematical proofs and problem-solving, and revise it incorporating peer feedback scoring ≥4/5 points in ≥4 of 5 rubric items

In 4-member teams, learners complete one 6-week PBL module for mathematical inquiry and real-world problem-solving using online collaboration tools (e.g., Google Workspace, Notion), submitting a 10-15-page project report and 10-minute presentation video. Teams must achieve ≥4/5 points in ≥4 of 5 rubric items

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
